alert.note: Alert for Caswell; Rockingham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 3:25AM EDT until August 22 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHWESTERN CASWELL AND SOUTHEASTERN ROCKINGHAM COUNTIES... At 325 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and storms ending across the warning area. However, 2 to 4 inches of rain since 1pm will likely cause flash flooding of creeks and streams, especially south of Reidsville. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Reidsville... Camp Springs... Jericho... Baynes... This includes the following streams and drainages... Country Line Creek, Benton Branch, Grays Branch, Burkes Creek, Haw River and Benaja Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
